definition: to warm up/to heat up/hot (of weather)/heat/fervent

sentences.english: Of course, the sensory effects of coffee, and other warm beverages, like tea or cocoa, can lift your spirits.
sentences.chinese: 当然，咖啡和类似茶，可可等其它热饮能提神。

sentences.english: His wife mixed him a hot drink.
sentences.chinese: 他妻子为他调制了一杯热饮。

sentences.english: The invention will be applicable to the manufacture of machines for the preparation of hot drinks, such as coffee-making machines.
sentences.chinese: 本发明适用于热饮生产机器例如咖啡机的制造。

sentences.english: You should have a hot drink.
Do hot drinks cool you down?
Use warm fluids in your water bottle to avoid freezing or tuck it under your jacket.
sentences.chinese: 在水瓶中加入热饮以免结冰，或把水瓶放在夹克里。

sentences.english: Direct drink. If heating please get rid of package.
sentences.chinese: 可直接饮用，如需热饮，建议不要带包装加热。

sentences.english: Most important advantage is that having three cups of the hot beverage daily can repel heart disease.
sentences.chinese: 最有益的事，每天喝三杯热饮能抵抗心脏病。

sentences.english: Nowadays Slings are exclusively made long on-the-rocks and toddies exclusively hot.
sentences.chinese: 现在司令专用长饮杯，棕榈酒则专用热饮杯。

sentences.english: The chocolate "medicine" will be delivered in a liquid form, similar to hot chocolate.
sentences.chinese: 巧克力“药”将制成液体形式，很像巧克力热饮。
